body:
### Leitwarte. Take control of your deployments. For Meteor.

[Leit-war-te](https://www.howtopronounce.com/german/leitwarte/): A place with lots of knobs and monitors to monitor and run a complex plant. German for control room. 

Leitwarte is a tool to manage hosts, deploy software using [Ansible](http://www.ansible.com/) and Meteor applications via [Docker/mup](https://github.com/arunoda/meteor-up).

Lots to do... see the [Trello board](https://trello.com/b/Fracwcz8/leitwarte-roadmap).

## Usage
For ease of use you can use [Docker](https://www.docker.com/) to deploy Leitwarte. That way you do not need to know anything about Meteor, the underlying technology used for Leitwarte.
Leitwarte needs a MongoDB to connect to. If you do not have one, you can start a Docker container for it:

```
docker run --name leitwarte-mongo -d mongo
```

Then run the leitwarte container using

```
docker run -d \
-e ROOT_URL=http://leitwarte.local \
-e MONGO_URL=mongodb://leitwarte-mongo:27017 \
-p 80:3000 \
--link leitwarte-mongo:mongo \
--name leitwarte-web \
leitwarte/leitwarte
```
